insight: ChatControl's Discord integration requires the DiscordSRV plugin. Users must disable DiscordSRV's built-in chat relay by setting `DiscordChatChannelMinecraftToDiscord: false` in DiscordSRV's `config.yml`, otherwise messages get duplicated. ChatControl checks this on startup and logs a warning if it's still enabled (see ChatControl.java line ~247).

When using `ignore receiver perm` in join/quit/death/timed message .rs files, wildcard permissions (`*`) from permission plugins like LuckPerms will match the custom permission (e.g. `chatcontrol.silence.join`), causing the message to be hidden from ALL players — not just the intended ones. Users should either negate the permission for default groups (`/lp group default permission set chatcontrol.silence.join false`) or flip the logic to use `require receiver perm` instead.
